attributes.action: Keep the maned railway barrier at Frinton on Sea
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The manned level crossing in Frinton on Sea is part of its heritage.
To replace this piece of history with an automatic barrier would deprive Frinton on Sea of its character and could be the first step in corrupting the character that many people have strived to maintain.

Frinton has fought tooth and nail to keep arcades, amusements and general tat away and maintain the Edwardian genteel feel of the resort a feel that residents feel is missing in other seaside towns.

The gates should be restored to there former glory so once again they can be called “The Golden Gates" and once again be the focal point of the town.
